summary:
In 2002 I undertook an internship as a designer in “Samoa Industrial” a mechanical engineering company, working in the design and production departments.
Following my internship, I was employed at “Gondan Shipyard” in April 2003, during my 9 years on the technical and production department as a Naval designer, I have worked on a large number of projects and on different phases of them, from detailed engineering, block construction or outfitting among the others. I have been gradually taking more responsibilities, starting from 3D modelling, drafting structure and piping systems, to management of the structural drafting team and problem solving on-board. 
After these years in Spain, having had the opportunity to learn the advanced structures construction methodology used in the shipyard, I decided to continue my professional development in another country and sector; in April 2012, I started to work in a worldwide company “Global Maritime consultancy”, where I currently perform the role of senior offshore designer within the design team. 
Being part of a company such a Global Maritime, focus in concept and basic designs make me aware of the challenges in the early stage of the design, my role encompasses all aspects of design and regulatory framework.
Nowadays, I am working in Oceanco (mega-yacht shipbuilding) in the Netherlands as a senior structural engineer and my responsibilities are coordination of the structural engineering package, supervision of the internal engineers and the subcontractors for each project.

profile_positions.description:
Senior Offshore Designer – Design department in Global Maritime Consultancy Ltd.		    
•	Conceptual and basic designs of ships and offshore structures.
•	Liaising with engineers and technicians to solve a wide range of diverse and complex          
        engineering problems.
•	3D & 2D modelling and design of ship hull, topsides, cranes and other structures.
•	Familiar with the Ship Class Rules, IMO Codes/ conventions and regulations such as SOLAS,  
        MARPOL, and other maritime technical codes. 
	
•	Projects: 
•	West Navigator drill ship cranes upgrade. 
•	Pipe Lay Barge (PLBH) – 3D modelling & Structural modification
•	Four legs Jack-up (Turbine installation) “Wind Jack” – General arrangements & legs design
•	Semi Submersible accommodation rig GM-500 – Mechanical system layouts & structural  
        drawings
•	Flotation production unit (FPU) “Sea Lion” – Structural drawings & accommodation layouts
•	GM Drafting Standards – Creation and development
•	Four legs Jack-up “Teras Sunrise” – Motor thrusters replacement
•	Four legs Jack-up “Work jack” – Mechanical & electrical system layouts
•	Jacking structure design for a  four legs jack-up

profile_positions.description:

        and onboard.

        adequacy, coherence, accuracy and compliance with the company´s standards and 
        procedures.
•	Dealing with classification society and client comments.

•	Meeting the project and tasks deadlines following the schedule.
